meanings.definition: In a nearsighted manner; lacking the ability to see distant objects clearly.
meanings.sent1: She squinted nearsightedly at the blurry road sign.
meanings.sent2: He always reads nearsightedly, holding the book close to his face.
meanings.sent3: The detective searched nearsightedly for clues, missing the obvious footprint.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered nearsightedly, unable to focus on the distant future.
meanings.sent5: The owl hooted nearsightedly, unable to spot its prey in the dark.

meanings.definition: With a focus on short-term goals or immediate concerns.
meanings.sent1: The nearsightedly planned project was completed quickly but lacked long-term success.
meanings.sent2: She made nearsightedly decisions that benefited her now but caused problems later.
meanings.sent3: The nearsightedly manager only cared about daily profits, ignoring future growth.
meanings.sent4: His nearsightedly approach to finances left him unprepared for unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: The nearsightedly student focused on passing the test, neglecting to learn for understanding.
